result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik M. Madland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: EACH COUNT CONCURRENT

miscConds.notes: Jail sentence with Huber privileges may be served in Pierce, Pepin, St Croix, Dunn or Polk County
Expungement may be applied for if the defendant successfully completes probation.
Expungement may be applied for if the defendant successfully completes probation.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Note from Sheila Drazkowski the court obligations are paid in full

09:44 Defendant Erik M. Madland in court. Prosecuting Atty Sean Edward Froelich appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court notes that outstanding balance due of $486.00 due before March 30. Defendant states that he can pay that amount before March 230, 2017. If defendant does not pay, court informs defendant that probation will be extended. Court states that minutes will be forwarded to probation agent, Sheila.
Probation review hearing on February 14, 2017 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 3:40  Defendant Erik M. Madland in court with attorney James H. Krave.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.14CF186   vacate the judgment of convictions( amended information was filed on this case with only the stalking charge remaining) on the 2 misdemeanor counts that have been refiled in 15CM46  . Th guilty plea and the DPA in 14CF186 will stand on the felony Ct 1. Amended information was filed on 3-5 15  dropped the other counts in the original complaint.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form that was  filed with the court on March 3.  Court reviews with Def . Intitial appearance is  conducted by the court. The counts in this case are reviewed with the defendant. Probation 2 years is the recomendation.  Ct 1 defendant pleads guilty.  Ct 2 Defendant pleads guilty.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 & 2.  Court orders S/W Probation 2 years on each ct conc. to each other. 7 days jail as a condtion of probation stayed until May 1, 2015 at 7:00 pm. If the defendant successfully completes probation   Huber will be allowed. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.   Epungment will be granted if the defendant successfully completes the probation
